    knit-engines

    knit-engines.Rmd
    library(atusydown)

    Additional engines for knitr

    glue

    The glue engine is useful in programatically writing texts. As documented in ?glue::glue,

    Expressions enclosed by braces will be evaluated as R code. Long strings are broken by line and concatenated together. Leading whitespace and blank lines from the first and last lines are automatically trimmed.

    For example, let’s substitute {name} by “Atusy”.

    First use r engine like below.

    name <- "Atusy"

    And then use glue engine like below.

    ```{glue}
**My name is {name}.**
This output is powered by glue package!
```

    My name is Atusy. This output is powered by glue package!

    Nice text! The output text is rendered as Pandoc’s markdown.

    Extra arguments of glue::glue() can be controlled by specifying glue.args. A following example replaces a expression enclosed by percents (% and %) instead of default braces ({ and })

    ```{glue, glue.args = list(.open = "%", .close = "%")}
**My name is %name%.**
This output is powered by glue package!
```

    My name is Atusy. This output is powered by glue package!

    options

    The options engine is useful for debugging. By running a current chunk or by knitting, you can see chunk options of a current chunk as a structure of a list.

    ```{options}
code("options")
```
    #> List of 58
#>  $ eval         : logi TRUE
#>  $ echo         : logi FALSE
#>  $ results      : chr "markup"
#>  $ tidy         : logi FALSE
#>  $ tidy.opts    : NULL
#>  $ collapse     : logi TRUE
#>  $ prompt       : logi FALSE
#>  $ comment      : chr "#>"
#>  $ highlight    : logi TRUE
#>  $ strip.white  : logi TRUE
#>  $ size         : chr "normalsize"
#>  $ background   : chr "#F7F7F7"
#>  $ cache        : num 0
#>  $ cache.path   : chr "knit-engines_cache/html/"
#>  $ cache.vars   : NULL
#>  $ cache.lazy   : logi TRUE
#>  $ dependson    : NULL
#>  $ autodep      : logi FALSE
#>  $ cache.rebuild: logi FALSE
#>  $ fig.keep     : chr "high"
#>  $ fig.show     : chr "asis"
#>  $ fig.align    : chr "default"
#>  $ fig.path     : chr "/home/rstudio/R/pkg/atusydown/docs/articles/knit-engines_files/figure-html/"
#>  $ dev          : chr "png"
#>  $ dev.args     : list()
#>  $ dpi          : int 192
#>  $ fig.ext      : chr "png"
#>  $ fig.width    : num 7.29
#>  $ fig.height   : num 4.51
#>  $ fig.env      : chr "figure"

#>  $ fig.scap     : NULL

#>  $ fig.subcap   : NULL

#>  $ out.height   : NULL

#>  $ ref.label    : NULL
#>  $ child        : NULL
#>  $ engine       : chr "options"

#>  $ label        : chr "options"
#>  $ out.width.px : num 700
#>  $ out.height.px: num 433
#>  $ code         : chr "The content of chunk is ignored."
#>  $ params.src   : chr "options, engine=\"options\""
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "knitr_strict_list"

    If you only want to output chunk options different from knitr::opts_chunk$get(), specify options.diff = TRUE as a chunk option.

    ```{options, foo = "bar", options.diff = TRUE}

```
    #> List of 11
#>  $ echo         : logi FALSE
#>  $ cache        : num 0
#>  $ dpi          : int 192
#>  $ out.width    : num 700
#>  $ engine       : chr "options"
#>  $ foo          : chr "bar"
#>  $ label        : chr "unnamed-chunk-2"
#>  $ out.width.px : num 700
#>  $ out.height.px: num 433
#>  $ code         : chr ""
#>  $ params.src   : chr " foo = \"bar\", options.diff = TRUE, engine=\"options\""
